QuestionJSON.Question: Phoenix is working on a history project about innovations in papermaking and printing technology. They decide to develop a computer program as part of their project that showcases the timeline of these innovations. Which of the following actions would be the most appropriate way for Phoenix to give attribution for the information used in their program?
QuestionJSON.Answer1: Copying and pasting information directly from the internet into their program with no reference to the source
QuestionJSON.Answer2: Rewording the information found on the internet and not citing the sources
QuestionJSON.Answer3: Including a 'Credits' page in their program that lists all the sources and their respective authors where they obtained the information
QuestionJSON.Answer4: Informing the teacher privately about the sources but not including it in the program
QuestionJSON.Explanation: Providing attribution in the form of a 'Credits' page in their program is the appropriate way of crediting the sources. This will make the source information accessible to everyone who uses the program.
